title: Thunderbird (macOS) - unify pop3 and imap accounts
content:
Hello there,

I am using Thunderbird 128.11.1esr on macOS Ventura 13.7.6 (OCLP) and would like to have all my accounts displayed in one unified inbox:

https://assets-prod.sumo.prod.webservices.mozgcp.net/media/uploads/images/2025-06-16-23-42-32-0314df.png

In the past all my accounts relied on pop3, but now of them changed to imap only, which now shows up like this:

https://assets-prod.sumo.prod.webservices.mozgcp.net/media/uploads/images/2025-06-16-23-43-14-1d6721.png

Is there a way for me to have just one inbox folder? I set it up like this ages ago but can't recall which steps need to be taken to receive the desired view.

If I choose View > Folders > Unified folders I get this:

https://assets-prod.sumo.prod.webservices.mozgcp.net/media/uploads/images/2025-06-16-23-45-37-4f8cd1.png

Thanks in advance!

title: Can't change the background color when replying to html formatted emails, e.g. from support ticket systems
content:
When I receive some special html formatted email e.g. from ticket system like Zendesk they look like this: https://assets-prod.sumo.prod.webservices.mozgcp.net/media/uploads/images/2025-06-17-01-06-32-c4ca42.png

When I want to reply to the text stays at the blue colored background and the text would be hard to read and it looks ugly: https://assets-prod.sumo.prod.webservices.mozgcp.net/media/uploads/images/2025-06-17-01-06-37-c81e72.png

Unfortunately I can't change background color to blank or white in Tunderbird 139.0.2. In menu of reply window "Page colors and Background", "Use custom colors", "Background" I can set to #ffffff of course, click apply and ok, but that doesn't change it: https://assets-prod.sumo.prod.webservices.mozgcp.net/media/uploads/images/2025-06-17-01-06-42-eccbc8.png

I suppose it relies to the html formatting of the received email because on starting to write a complete new email it works. But that's very annoying that Thunderbird doesn't manage to change background colors on already formatted html body. Is this a bug or only poor source code and the programmer didn't have much motivation to write and robust code which could gather all html emails?

Could you check with this test email to test and reproduce? https://limewire.com/d/pqbEk#1idjNje6b2

Thanks a lot! I'd be very happy about your help.
creator: riegel

title: There are times when I suddenly cannot receive new emails on Thunderbird.
content: I have set up a Microsoft 365 account in Thunderbird to send and receive emails. Suddenly, I cannot receive new emails on Thunderbird. Even if I manually attempt to send/receive emails, new emails are not received. No error messages are displayed. When I log into Webmail (Outlook), I can see the newly arrived emails. Upon checking with Microsoft, they indicated that the root cause seems to be related to the failure in properly updating the UIDL map and UIDL history. Reinstalling the Thunderbird application did not resolve the issue. Could you please advise on how to address this problem?

title: Problema apertura messaggi di posta salvati in cartelle di rete.
content:
Buon pomeriggio, è mia abitudine catalogare i messaggi che mi arrivano salvandoli in delle cartelle di rete (precisamente su un NAS di rete). Improvvisamente mi succede che riaprendo i messaggi salvati si apre la finestra di thunderbird completamente bianca. Ho notato che il problema si presenta aprendo la cartella di rete con l'indirizzo IP:

\\Indirizzo IP NAS\cartella condivisa\messaggio.eml -> (Finestra bianca)

Mentre se apro la cartella da risorse di rete, e quindi con il nome del NAS, il messaggio si apre regolarmente:

\\Nome_NAS\cartella condivisa\messaggi.eml -> (Finestra con il messaggio visualizzato)

Quale può essere il problema?

Grazie Giorgio
creator: mejgio

title: Sending email with Outlook SMTP
content:
I have an issue where its seems like one of my email accounts cannot get the correct password.

I have been using ChatGPT for help and here is its summary of the issue -

Description: I’m using Thunderbird (latest version) on Windows and have two Outlook 365 accounts configured: a1@adagioconcepts.com (hosted via Office 365 from GoDaddy) — fully working a2@floetermusic.com (also hosted via Office 365 from GoDaddy) — receiving works via POP3, but sending via SMTP fails Both accounts are configured identically: SMTP server: smtp.office365.com Port: 587 Connection Security: STARTTLS Authentication Method: OAuth2 Username: matches the email address For a2@floetermusic.com, Thunderbird errors when I try to send email (wrong password). I have re-entered the password many times with no change in behavior. However, the other account (a1@adagioconcepts.com) authenticates and sends perfectly using OAuth2. I have: Confirmed that the SMTP server is assigned correctly to the failing account Reset Thunderbird’s login store (logins.json, key4.db) Deleted and re-added the SMTP entry Ensured both accounts use OAuth2 Verified that App Passwords are not available in my Microsoft 365 tenant (modern auth only) Thunderbird is clearly capable of handling OAuth2 SMTP with one account, but won’t initialize it for the other. Can anyone help determine why OAuth2 SMTP does not initiate for one account while working on another with identical settings and provider?

Thanks,
creator: avf431

title: Only TBird messages bounced as spam by two correspondents
content:
Hi TBird experts -

At my office with four users, we correspond with many companies using TBird in a Windows environment. We use our ISP's mail servers so our domain is @hawaiiantel.net. Every few weeks, one or two of our correspondents start bouncing our messages. The header is long but this is the important part:

Listed by CSS, see https://check.spamhaus.org/query/ip/64.98.42.38. - 

   https://community.mimecast.com/docs/DOC-1369#550    [bN0XCknkOUSxZxPgWtBa8A.usb39] (in reply to RCPT TO command)

We are showing up on a block list, obviously. It lasts a few days and stops. I didn't think TBird could have anything to do with it, but if I copy the body of my message, immediately open my Web Mail, create a message to the same recipient, and send it, it doesn't bounce. My co-workers are convinced this is a problem with TBird.

What are your thoughts? Many thanks in advance - JBusch223
creator: jbusch223

title: Thunderbird Calendar not updating timezone despite timezone info in ics file
content:
Hi

I work in NZ (NZST) which is two hours ahead of Australia (AEST). When I receive appointments from Australia, the time should update to NZST if the appropriate info is in the ICS file. However what is actually happenning is that Thunderbird is simply storing the appointment without converting the time zone, so a 2pm AEST appt becomes 2pm NZST not 4pm.

I have checked the appointments contain the appropriate information - see attached screenshot from Thunderbird for an example, showing the appointment details for an appt sent a few days ago. However when I accept this, the appt appears in my Calendar at 2pm.

I have checked and reset the local time zone as Pacific/Auckland and tried setting in manually and restarting and tried converting back to automatic and restarting. I have searched the help base on Mozilla. This suggests that Calendar SHOULD convert time zones so I am unsure why this not happening. I have even asked Chat GPT for help, with no success :-)

I am an avid Thunderbird supporter and have been a donor for many years. My Australian work is becoming more and more important and this problem is now reaching a point where it is affecting my work. I would really value any advice as to how to fix this as I will have to switch to using a Google Calendar if I can't get this to work somehow.

Best wishes Roland
creator: jollygreengiant
